findings.title: Invoice Access Control Bypass
findings.impact: Unauthorized access to financial data of other users/businesses
findings.proof_of_concept: GET /api/invoice/{id} - Successfully accessed invoices: [{'id': '1', 'status': 200, 'size': 4643, 'has_data': True}, {'id': '2', 'status': 200, 'size': 4643, 'has_data': True}, {'id': '100', 'status': 200, 'size': 4643, 'has_data': True}, {'id': '9999', 'status': 200, 'size': 4643, 'has_data': True}]
findings.remediation:
1. Verify user owns the invoice before serving
2. Add authorization middleware
3. Use UUID instead of sequential IDs

findings.title: Admin Panel Accessible to Regular User
findings.impact: Complete system compromise - can manage all users, settings, data
findings.proof_of_concept: Direct access to ['/admin', '/admin/dashboard', '/admin/users', '/admin/settings', '/api/admin/users', '/api/admin/config', '/superadmin', '/manage', '/system'] with regular user session
findings.remediation:
1. Implement role-based access control (RBAC)
2. Add admin middleware checks
3. Use separate admin authentication

findings.title: Access to Other User Profiles
findings.impact: Data breach - personal information of other users exposed
findings.remediation:
1. Verify requesting user matches requested user
2. Use session-based user lookup only
3. Remove username from URL, use /api/user/me instead
